page.title: 18EDUCATION IN FRILSHAM (2)
page.content: {Brockhurst School}is a large mansion built in the Georgian style in 1884 after the original house burnt down. It has lovely panelled rooms. It faces south and looks over the park and woods around. It has an estate of 1000 acres and was formerly Marlston House. It has stables and large playing fields.{Boys from 7 to 13}are prepared for public schools. There are 120 boys. The majority of them are boarders.{Classes are small}allowing much individual attention. It is{non- {denominational}but the boys attend Marlston Church which is in the school grounds. The school choir sings in the church. The school aims to provide a {good education in a happy atmosphere. In 1984 the school celebrated its centenary with a thanksgiving service at Marlston Church and a ball in a huge marquee.
